alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 2:26PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Major Winter Storm This Weekend... A strong surface low pressure is expected to develop in the Bering Sea on Saturday, posing another significant winter storm threat across the West Coast and Western Interior beginning Saturday and lasting through Sunday night. This storm will bring a strong push of moisture and warmer air that will result in snow, freezing rain, and rain across areas of the West Coast and Western Interior from the Seward Peninsula south during this time period. Heavy snow, significant blowing and drifting snow, and strong winds are expected further inland. The Chukchi Sea Coast east through the Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys will receive anywhere from 8 to 14 inches of snow, with winds gusting anywhere from 35 to 50 mph from Saturday afternoon through Sunday night. Residents should take proper precautions to ensure safety in preparation for any holiday travel over the weekend. Stay tuned to www.weather.gov/fairbanks as we continue to monitor changes to the outlook throughout the weekend.
